sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
The following system of linear equations needs to be solved using Gaussian elimination:

2x + 3y - z = 7  
4x - 2y + 3z = 8  
-3x + 2y + 7z = 10  

What are the values of x, y, and z that satisfy this system of equations?
message_2:
First, we will write the augmented matrix for the given system of linear equations:

|  2  3 -1 |  7 |
|  4 -2  3 |  8 |
| -3  2  7 | 10 |

Step 1: Divide the first row by 2 to get a leading 1:

|  1  3/2 -1/2 |  7/2 |
|  4  -2   3  |  8   |
| -3   2   7  |  10  |

Step 2: Eliminate the first element in the second and third rows by subtracting multiples of the first row:

Row2 = Row2 - 4 * Row1
Row3 = Row3 + 3 * Row1

|  1  3/2 -1/2 |  7/2 |
|  0 -5   5   | -3   |
|  0  5/2 19/2 | 31/2 |

Step 3: Divide the second row by -5 to get a leading 1:

|  1  3/2 -1/2 |  7/2 |
|  0  1  -1   |  3/5 |
|  0  5/2 19/2 | 31/2 |

Step 4: Eliminate the second element in the first and third rows by subtracting multiples of the second row:

Row1 = Row1 - (3/2) * Row2
Row3 = Row3 - (5/2) * Row2

|  1  0  1/2 |  2  |
|  0  1  -1  |  3/5|
|  0  0  9/2 |  7  |

Step 5: Divide the third row by 9/2 to get a leading 1:

|  1  0  1/2 |  2  |
|  0  1  -1  |  3/5|
|  0  0  1   | 14/9|

Step 6: Eliminate the third element in the first and second rows by subtracting multiples of the third row:

Row1 = Row1 - (1/2) * Row3
Row2 = Row2 + Row3

|  1  0  0   |  4/3|
|  0  1  0   |  5/3|
|  0  0  1   | 14/9|

Now, we can read the solution from the augmented matrix:

x = 4/3
y = 5/3
z = 14/9
